title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2727/88 of 31 August 1988 fixing, for unginned cotton, the actual production for the 1987/88 marketing year and the estimated production, the adjustment in the maximum guaranteed quantity and the reduction in the aid for the 1988/89 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2727/88
of 31 August 1988
fixing, for unginned cotton, the actual production for the 1987/88 marketing year and the estimated production, the adjustment in the maximum guaranteed quantity and the reduction in the aid for the 1988/89 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. For the 1987/88 marketing year, actual production of unginned cotton is hereby determined at 875 608 tonnes.
2. For the 1988/89 marketing year:
- the estimated production is hereby fixed at 1 086 902 tonnes,
- the maximum guaranteed quantity fixed by Regulation (EEC) No 2260/88 is hereby reduced by 46 758 tonnes,
- the reduction in the amount of the aid is hereby fixed at 19,200 ECU per 100 kilograms.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 1 September 1988.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 31 August 1988.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
